meanings.definition: Push, elbow, or bump against someone in a crowd.
meanings.sent1: In the busy market, people justle each other to get through.
meanings.sent2: The commuters justle for space on the crowded train.
meanings.sent3: Trying to justle past the group of friends, she accidentally dropped her phone.
meanings.sent4: The waves justle against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The children justle playfully in the playground, full of laughter.

meanings.definition: Jostle for position in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: During the game, players justle to gain control of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The candidates justle for the spotlight during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels justle for the last acorn, causing a funny scene in the park.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, companies justle for market dominance.
meanings.sent5: The political parties justle for power in the upcoming election.
